Name: Scene It? TV  Deluxe Edition
Description:
From the publisher:

TV trivia at its best!
With 50 years of TV packed into two DVDs, the Deluxe TV Edition of Scene It? is the quintessential television trivia game. From The Brady Bunch to Alias this game will keep players tuned in for hours and hours of TV entertainment.

Name: Battle Dot 1
Description: This game for Ages 4 and up and up helps them learn beginning math concepts like counting on. It plays similar to war, but instead of a standard playing card deck, each card shows a small sum represented by dots of different colors. Children lay down cards, then determine if they've won the hand by adding the sums. Comes with 24 large cards.

Name: Mr. Game
Description: Mr Game is a self contained game module system that contains the parts, boards and instructions to play 20 games: Baseball Bagatelle, Beat The Banker, Buck Dice, Checkers, Eight By Eight, Fox and Geese, Happy Face Puzzle, Help Your Neighbor, Hoop-La, Hoses and Ladders, Morris The Farmer, Parchisi, Queen Bee, Ship Captain Mate and Crew, Shuffleboard, Solitaire, Spin A Winner, Steeplechase, Tic-Tac-Toe, and Tiddly Winks.  The central Mr Game figure is used in many of these games, making standard games unique to Mr Game (for example, one of his arms shoots the shuffleboard disks and the balls for Baseball Bagatelle).  Designed and play tested with target audience of Ages 5 and up

Name: 'Eye Jinxx
Description:
From the Introduction to the Rules:
"Eye Jinxx, the jigsaw puzzle board game, can be enjoyed several ways.
It can be assembled cooperatively, by one or more persons, without rules or time constraints.
It can be assembled competitively, by two or more players/teams, in accordance with the rules, time limits, and scoring format provided. We recommend a maximum of FOUR teams, with no more than SIX players per team.
Also, whether playing cooperatively or competitively, there is the ongoing challenge of locating the eight hidden objects.
We recommend that prior to playing the game, the puzzle be assembled and the hidden objects be located."
Components include jigsaw puzzle pieces, game board, D6 die, 4 pencils, 3 minute sand timer, score pad, and 4 hidden object cards.
NGC 404
Copyright 1990 by Strathcona Mosaic Limited.

Name: PGA Tour Finger Golf
Description: Played on a high gloss durable mat that measures 2 feet by 4 feet, players flick a ringed ball-bearing towards the hole in a game that simulates the game of golf.

Name: Finger Baseball
Description: The game of baseball now in finger form.  One player pitches and the other bats.  The pitch starts by flicking the marker towards home plate.  Based upon where it lands the result could be a ball, strike, pending hit, or a player choices.  If it's a pending hit, then the batter must flick the marker and land on the corresponding "hit" location, otherwise it's an out.

Name: Problemas de Diccionario
Description:
This is a word meaning game with some particularities:
1.- It has card with STRANGE words, so they are very difficult and, because not a lot people know their meaning, allows to bluff and laugh a lot.
2.- Players start in the ignorance gear and must go until the knowledge gear.
3.- Each player has it’s own path on the board.
4.- Each path is different because contains different icons, that allows you to get bonus points if the image on the gear you are on mach the one in the card being played.

As with all this kind of games, players must give the meaning of the word that appears in a card. In they don’t know it they must bluff, so he can convince the other players that his meaning is the right one.  Each time they get a vote, he advance in the board until one of them reaches the knowledge gear.

Name: Intense Bridge
Description:
A published Bridge variant.
It uses Jill cards to allow the declarer to call "his" or "hers".
HIS ranks: A K Q Jack Jill 10 9 8 7 6 5 4 3 2
HER ranks: A Q K Jill Jack 10 9 8 7 6 5 4 3 2
A few other rules change this game from the standard Bridge game.

Name: Thrilling Tales of Adventure!
Description:
Thrilling Tales of Adventure! is set in the world of pulp fiction and adventure serials of the 1920s and 1930s. One player, the Arch Villain, attempts to build and execute dastardly plots while the remaining players -- each of whom assumes the role of a classic pulp hero -- try to foil these plots. Among the 10 heroes to choose from are Samantha Starr (intrepid reporter) Grigor the Great (former magician to the Tsar), and the Blue Falcon (ace aviatrix). The game plays out over three Acts, as the Arch Villain works toward the execution of a final Master Plan, such as the construction and activation of a massive death ray, or encasing the world in ice for all eternity.

The key mechanic of the game is the creation of "Adventures," linked sets of cards that the Heroes must investigate and overcome in order to collect Heroism points. There are two types of Adventures: "Wild Adventures," which are generated on the fly by a combination of card plays and draws from the various decks; and "Plots," which are custom-built by the Arch Villain player and have much higher stakes.

Name: Stopp!
Description: This game is basically a copy of the Hasbro-Game "Taboo": You explain words to your team members and try to avoid certain "Stopp-Words". Main difference: The explanation time is much shorter and you are only allowed to explain 1 card.

Name: I Doubt It
Description: The game is played with 5 dice that are marked like playing cards.  They have values: 9, 10, J, Q, K, A.  One player puts the dice in the box and shakes to randomize.  The player then looks at the dice without revealing their value to the other players. The player who "rolled" states a value for the dice which may be true or false. The other players must decide if they want to believe or doubt the value of the dice.

Name: Leap-in-a-Line
Description:
This is a childrens game that is based on Connect Four. The box contains a school bus shaped board, an alphabet road, 106 tokens and an instruction book. The tokens are divided into four different colors. Each color of token has a different picture set. These sets include shapes of various sizes and colors, letters with both uppercase and lowercase of various colors and pictures of different items with the word written on it(ex. a picture of a dog with the word dog written on it).

The different tokens allow the same board to be used for five different learning games.

Name: Bingory
Description:
Part Bingo, part Memory. Be the first to complete your Bingo card by collecting matching pairs and you win. Contents: 16 wooden matching pairs, 4 wooden Bingo cards, and a cotton pouch.

For Ages 4 and up.

Name: 3 in 1 Table-Top Sports
Description:
From the box:

CALLING ALL TABLETOP SPORTS FANS!

Flex your fingers and get ready to flick! Inside this cool package you'll find everything you need to play tabletop soccer, hockey, AND football!


     26 punch-out pieces for players, ballsa, and pucks!
     Two sturdy goalposts!
     Stickers!
     Dozens of game rules, flick tips, and more!


From the rulebook:

When's the last time you played a game of soccer, hockey and football...on the kitchen table? Get set to flex your fingers and challenge your friends! Use this book to score your way into the tabletop sports history books...

INCLUDES:


     Amazing finger flick techniques!
     Team uniform tips!
     Tabletop game rules!
     Scoring strategies!
     Plus! Other fast moves and quick tricks!

Name: Two Up
Description:
One of Australia's many contributions to the world of gambling. The game is conducted in a flat circle of approximately 20 feet (6 metres) or larger. The only equipment required (aside from materials for tracking bets) is two coins (by tradition pre-decimal pennies), and a flat piece of wood called the "kip" approximately 8 inches in length which has holes carved in it to fit the coins neatly but loosely enough for the coins to come out when tossed.

The game is run by a "boxer", who calls the first "potato" (one of the players around the circle) in to toss the coins. The spinner wagers an amount of their choice on either "heads" or "tails". Other players around the ring can then also bet on either "heads" or "tails". .

Once all bets are taken, the boxer calls "no more bets", and the player tosses the coins in the air using the kip. To be a valid throw, they must go above the head height of the spinner, be rotating sufficiently and land entirely in the ring - if they do not the boxer calls "barred" and the throw is retaken. Ideally the call must occur before the coins settle.

If the coins land both on the same face, the round ends and non-spinning player's bets are paid off, with people who bet on the same face as that landed winning. A new round of non-spinner bets is then taken before the spinner throws again.

If the coins come up with one tail and one head, the spinner spins again. If 5 "odds" come up, all players lose and a new spinner is selected.

If the spinner throws his nominated face three times before either 5 "odds" being thrown in a row, or a spin with both coins being the opposite face, the spinner wins and is paid at 7.5 to 1 (in most modern games).

Name: Odd
Description:
Odd is a simple abstract game for 2 players, with stones of 2 colors, typically played on a hexagonally tiled board with 5 cells on each edge (though it can be played on almost any tiling). Odd can also be played with pencil and paper.

Definitions:  

     A group is a set of stones on the board, all of the same color, for which it is possible to trace a continuous path between any two of  them by stepping between adjacent stones of that color.
     The size of a group is the number of stones in it.  


Rules:

     The board begins empty.
     Players take turns.  On each turn a player places one stone of either color onto any empty space.
     The game ends when the board is full.  Player 1 wins if there is an odd number of groups of at least size 5 on the board, and Player 2 wins otherwise.  When counting groups, be sure add up the total number of connected groups of both colors.


Notes:

     One can change the character of the game by increasing or decreasing the minimum size which a group must have in order to be counted at the end. The larger the minimum group size, the more strategic and less tactical the game becomes, and vice-versa

Name: Oz Quiz 2000
Description:
The updated version of 1984's Oz Quiz.
The crazy, zany around-Australia trivia game.
Over 2000 questions. Comes packaged in an esky as per the original.

Name: My First Card Games
Description:
This is children’s game that contains rules and card sets for Math Rummy and Alphabet Go Fish. Also included in the box are four children’s card holders to allow young children hold a hand of cards.

The Math Rummy game has 24 cards that contain number cards (1-10) and plus cards, minus cards and a board to create simple equations. The Math Rummy rules contain the rules for two games of various difficulties as well as teach-me tips on using this game with children.

The Alphabet Go Fish game has 78 cards, three of each letter with a representative item for that letter on the card (ex. key for k). The cards are also in six different colors to allow for color matching games. The Alphabet Go Fish rules contain the rules for three games of various difficulty as well as teach-me tips on using this game with children.

Name: Omniana
Description:
Omniana is a fantasy card game in which players use their imagination to creatively debate battles between many strange & absurd characters in a multitude of exotic & normal locations.
 On each Character Card there is a brief description of an original character detailing his special abilities, weaknesses and history. Players take turns sending one of their characters into an opponent's situation to battle against that opponent's pre-selected character. One or more of the remaining players will judge each battle. Using only the information on their cards, both of the battling players must argue how and why his character would win in a duel. The judge(s) decides the victor and awards him either a treasure or an advantage card. The player with the most treasure at the end of the game wins.

Home Page: http://www.omnianathegame.com

Name: Sonny the Seal
Description:
"Clapping, Barking, Bobbing, and Tipping - the motorized hoopla game!"

Toss rings around the neck of a motorized seal as it bobs around and makes seal noises.

Name: Pooh's Scavenger Hunt Game
Description:
From the manufacturer's web site:

Join Pooh, Piglet, Eeyore and Tigger for a most exciting adventure. Collect everything on your list. Everyone wins!
Several ways to play for different skill levels. Features chunky cards for small hands.

Develops shape and color recognition, counting skills and cooperative play.

For Ages 3 and up.

Name: Do You Sudoku? Game for Kids
Description:
To play, players roll the die, make the sound of the animal on the die, then try to place that animal on their grid. This is a kids version of Do You Sudoku? that involves 6 animals pictures on a 6 X 6 grid instead of the numbers 1 - 9 on a 9 X 9 grid.

From the publisher's web site:
Find a Home for Every Animal on the Farm!

Oink! Moo! Baa! Our Do you Sudoku? Game for Kids brings the logic solving challenge of Sudoku puzzles together with cute farm animals. Here's a fun way for children and parents to play together while developing patterning and logic skills.

Players roll a die, make the noise of their favorite animals and try to place the animal tile onto the correct space.

The Rules Are Simple
No animal can appear twice in the same 6 square box or in a line up and down or in a line across.

Contains 30 puzzle cards (60 puzzles), 108 animal tiles and 1 die.

Ages 6 & up.

Name: Yale-Princeton Football Game
Description: Large, colorful football themed boardgame with beautiful graphics. Comes with wooden play pieces and spinners.

Name: Monopoly: Indianapolis Colts Super Bowl XLI Champions Commemorative Edition
Description:
The Colts Super Bowl XLI Champions Edition of the Monopoly game is the only game that allows Colts fans the opportunity to buy, sell and trade the greatest players and coaches from the Super Bowl XLI Champion Colts in an effort to control their favorite team. Bankrupt your opponents and own it all. A must have for all Colts fans!

Officially licensed by the NFL

Name: ShaNuCo
Description:
ShaNuCo, according to the game's rulebook, stands for Shapes, Numbers and Colors.

It is a card game with 76 very large playing cards (Approx. 3" x 4").  Of these, 64 are marked with all combinations of  the numbers 1-4, each color of blue, red, purple and green, and either a circle, star, square or triangle.

The rest of the cards are either Wild, Super Wild, Pass or Show cards, in some combination of the three characteristics that the main cards represent.

It's box is approximately 4.5" x 6" x 1".  Instructions are in English, French and Spanish, and fit on both sides of a 4" x 6" sheet of paper (per language).

2-4 Players. 
The box claims 4-104 as appropriate ages for the game, but the rules are possibly too sophisticated for a child under 6 or 8 years of age.

The object of the game is to gain the most points after 5 rounds of play. Each player starts with 100 points, and each round a player may both gain or lose points, depending on game play.

Copyright 1996.
Published by International Playthings, Inc. (Parsippany, NJ, USA), it appears to be their product number P55001.  Also credited on the box are Creative Concepts, Inc. and Excel Development Group, Inc. "Made in Canada"

Name: The Flintstones Mitt-Full Game
Description: Dexterity game that features mitts shaped to look like Fred, Wilma, Barney and Betty. The object of the game is to keep a ball balanced on the mitt without it rolling off as you try to do a series of moves determined by cards that you draw.

Name: Flying Thunder
Description:
The game is played on a 16-square foot playing mat with an electronic helicopter placed in the middle and controlled from a remote that runs under the mat. Players choose to be either Blue or Red (teams can be created if there are more than 2 players)and alternate turns. The object of the game is to collect bomb tokens totaling 6 or more points before the other player(or team).

The tokens are spread out on the mat with the point value face down and the player must pick up the tokens with the helicopter(the points become visible once picked up)and dropped onto the designated headquarters. There are also bomb and spy tokens that need to be dropped into the bomb bunker or the competing players headquarters, respectively.

That is the main play, there are also solo mission and time variations.

Name: Goomicus Alphabet Soup Word Game
Description:
Alphabet Soup Word Game. The starting player takes the spoon and ladles out 2 spoonfuls of letters for himself, then passes the bowl to the next player until everyone has their own 2 spoonfuls (approximately 30-35 letters total). Each player tries to use all their letters to construct words. Object is to achieve the highest letter word score in a given period of time. The Goomicus is a free letter and can be used to represent any letter of the alphabet. Scores are calculated by the number of syllables in each word, by the number of letters used, and by the number of Goomicus tiles used. Penalties may incur for unused letters depending on the chosen difficulty of the game. You can play competitively, on teams, or freestyle depending on the player ages.

Contents: Instruction pamphlet; bowl; spoon; 130 connectable letters (8 of which are Goomicus which is wild)

Ages 6 and up

Name: Einstein
Description:
A computer with electronic lights and sounds. You have to do what Einstein tells you to do.  Similar to "Simon" and "Maniac".

Made by Castle Toy Company in 1979 for ages 6 to adult and one or more players. Requires four “C” batteries.

Name: Walt Disney's Mickey Mouse If I Were In Your Shoes Game
Description: Collect the most tokens by staying out of another player's shoes. Ages 8 and up

Name: Madagascar Card Game
Description:
From the manufacturer's site:

I have Alex the Lion! Who has Marty the Zebra? If you have the right cards and the right speed - you win! Kids will love playing with their favorite Madagascar characters as they race to respond in order to win the game. This game also helps children build letter recognition and strengthen their reading vocabulary by using picture clues. Housed in a sturdy travel-tin, this card game includes two decks for two different ways to play. Includes 24 animal cards with green borders and 24 animal/letter cards with blue borders.

Ages 4 and up.

Name: Bones
Description:
Made by Ponder Mason Games in 1986 for Ages 7 and up.

Bones is a high rolling, exciting and challenging dice game with a race to get bonus points. It may be played solitaire or as many players as one wishes.

COMPLETE contents include: 5 dice, score cards, roll em’ bones pencil, and the instructions.

OBJECT: Finish the game with the highest score. Fun and thrills till the very last roll.

Name: Slumber Party
Description:
The game of fun and laughs for girls. So much fun your friends won’t want to leave!

Made by Cadaco in 1990 for up to six girls Ages 8 and up.

OBJECT: Be the first player to get rid of all your rollers, by acting, drawing, answering questions, doing a silly stunt, whatever the game cards tell you to do.

Contents include: 30 plastic hair rollers, pencil, timer, 110 game cards, Dear Diary with notepad, and the instructions.

Name: Happy Landing
Description:
A geography game made by Whitman in 1962 for 2-4 players Ages 12 and up.

A help yourself educational game for home and school.

COMPLETE contents include: large world map, colored disks, question cards, smaller map, cardboard inserts, and the instructions.

OBJECT: To acquire the greatest number of points by identifying locations indicated on the cards.

Name: In Other Words...
Description:
"In Other Words...
is a fun-filled mix of recall, deduction, strategy and wit.  Players advance around the board by solving paraphrased clues to well-known titles, common terms, and popular sayings."

This game bills itself as the "Original Game of Paraphrases".

In this game, players move around the board and solve puzzles in one of five categories
-Movies and Television
-Terms
-Quotes & Sayings
-Literature
-Cliches & Expressions
-Music

The puzzles are in the form of phrases that have to be translated into the actual saying on the card.  For example, the movie "Away With the Breeze" is "Gone With the Wind", and the book "The Victor's Ring" is "The Winner's Circle".

Name: Lion Sleeps Tonight Electronic Game
Description: This game has 2 levels of play for children Ages 3 and up. For the littlest children, you move according to color on the die. Older children move by number. It's a race to make it through the jungle, but meanwhile a lion is sleeping to his favorite song. If he wakes up during a child's move, they must hide in a bush. The first to get through the jungle wins.

Name: Show & Tell Game
Description:
A storytelling game for 2 to 4 players ages Ages 3 - 8.

The game consists of a board, spinner, and grab bag full of little toys. On each turn, a player gets to pick a toy from the bag. When a player lands on a storytelling space, he must tell a story involving all of the toys he has collected and the picture on the space he landed on. The first player to tell two stories wins.

Name: One Fish Two Fish Red Fish Blue Fish Game
Description:
For 2 to 4 players Ages 3 - 8.

Use your magnetic fishing pole to collect fish and put them together to make a puzzle. Includes 4 fishing poles, and 16 fish in 4 different colors.

Name: Word Roulette
Description:
Read the clue on the card, spin the wheel and the first person who calls out a correct answer starting with the letter spun keeps the card which is counted as one point.

Similar to another game I know but this has a very solid well made wooden spinner with all the letters of the alphabet on it.

Name: DarkeStorme
Description:
From Publisher:
The fantastical world of Valon in the Dark Age.  The time of swords and decaying Empires when Wylde Magicke ruled.  Monsters and mayhem fit for champions.  A world consumed by war and plunder where you as a Hero lead your band on a quest for riches and fame.  Will the fates shine on you?

DarkeStorme has an easily learned 2D6 based rules system that is scenario driven with a normal game lasting between one and two hours in play.  The game book features full rules, no need for expansions, create and advance your characters and creatures using a full points and species generation system.  Also a full magic system and all needed rules for Chariots, Artillery and Monsters.  Generate scenarios, the terrain and even the weather!

Name: Pyramid
Description:
Pyramid is a memory game for children. 2 to 6 players explore a Pyramid by lifting two lids.  Should the icons be the same as the icons on any of the cards the player is holding in his hand, he may discard the card in question.  The first who get rid of their cards is the winner.

Contents:
1 board with windows
15 lids to cover the windows with
15 tokens with icons
42 playing cards

Name: Flip kick
Description: This dexterity football (soccer) game is played on a little wooden table (58 x 40 x 8 cm) where each player tries to roll the ball in the opponent's goal using good old flipper (just like in a pinball machine). The play field is curved and filled with little rubber "players" which bounce the ball around.

Name: Go Fetch It
Description:
Go Fetch it is an exciting race game which uses an audio tape for both a full explanation of the rules & continuous instructions and music throughout the game play.  The game consists of a game board, four dogs and a cassette tape. The dogs are set up on the board, then the tape is played. The players follow the instructions on the tape, as in "Dog X! Move forward two squares!" or "All dogs on yellow squares move back one square!" etc.

There are also some large plastic bones which have to be hidden or searched in other rooms than the ones the game takes place in. While one player is out for that task, the others continue - so the player outside should hurry.  This unique & exciting game can be played at many different levels of difficulty & has numerous permutations of game play. You can start the game anywhere through the one hour tape !

Name: Lace Wars: Wargaming the Period 1660-1720
Description:
Subtitle: "Wargaming the period 1660-1720"

Three different scale rules with mostly common mechanics.

Scale/One Unit/One inch:
1. Skirmish/Company (80-150 men)/25yd
2. Tactical/Battalion (400-600 men)/50yd
3. Grand/Brigade (3-5 battalions)/100yd

In addition to the rules, the book contains cardstock Play sheets, color-printed period Flags , 2 army lists (War of Spanish Succession France and Britain) and 5 scenarios. Complexity is not high, Play sheets consists of just 3 pages for all three scales. Typical play area is 6' x 4'.

There are 4 scenario books published.
1: Wars of Glory [Louis XIV's War of Devolution, Dutch & Rhineland Wars]
2: Wars of Grand Alliance [War of G.A., War in Ireland, Tangiers Campaign and Monmouth Rebellion]
3: The Great Northern & Turkish Wars
4: Wars of the Spanish Succession
Each scenario book contains several army lists, more than a dozen scenarios and color Flags.
Families: History: War of the Spanish Succession

Name: 11 Kings
Description:
A civilization game for 6+ players.  The game is intended to be played with big groups and generally lasts around 7 hours.

This game was intended to be both flexible and  streamlined. It's a civilization game with a modular hex board, a small number of technologies and relatively simple rules. Diplomacy is an important aspect of the game.

Name: Star Fleet Cards
Description:
This is non-collectible card game of spaceship combat set in the Star Trek universe.  It is heavily inspired by the hex-and-counter game Star Fleet Battles.  It is limited to a duel between two ships.

Each player gets a unique deck of cards that represents actions that their type of ship can make.  Each turn players play cards based on how much energy their ship can still produce.  At the point in the game when one players ship can no longer produce energy and therefore not play cards, that ship is considered defeated/destroyed and is considered the loser.

Name: Mr. Detective
Description: Obviously inspired by Clue, the object of the game is to move from city to city (rather than from room to room) to discern the location of a hidden bomb within eight game-days. A decently produced game, one of several released in 1985 by obscure Kits Game Corporation.

Name: Habet, Hoc Habet!
Description:
From the back cover:

The bloodthirsty spectators of the gladiatorial arena would shout out "Habet, hoc habet!" whenever a gladiator fell in combat.  Now you can recreate those violent contests with the latest miniature wargaming rules from Flagship Games.  Habet, Hoc Habet! includes:


     Rules for recreating gladiator combat, where the actions of the individual determine all!
     A campaign system where you play the gladiators' owner, training them for their bloody task, and sending them to their fate on the sands of the arena!
     All the weapons used by the gladiators of ancient times!
     Chariot races!
     Hours of enjoyment for you and your gaming buddies!


Habet, Hoc Habet! faithfully recreates the life of the gladiator and the gladiator's owner, the Lanista, as the later strives to make his fortune while the former does his best to stay alive!

Habet, Hoc Habet! is a great game for two players or a whole club.  You can play out an entire campaign in the course of an evening, and no more than a single figure per person is needed!

Make a claim for glory.  Play Habet, Hoc Habet!

BONUS FEATURE: Fantasy Gladiator Rules!

Home Page: http://www.flagshipgames.com/html/habet__hoc_habet_.html

Name: Racepoly
Description: In Racepoly: The Race of the Century, players first engage in an "authentic auction" for international-class race horses, then pit their horses against each other in a complex race involving money management and various pitfalls. One of several decently produced games issued in 1985 by obscure Kits Game Corporation.

Name: Lucky Luke: Villin lännen peli
Description:
Lucky Luke - A Game of the Wild West is a simple set collection game. There are ten different gangs of outlaws in the deck. Each turn, one outlaw card is turned face up. Each player chooses one of their sheriff cards, which are then revealed simultaneously. The player with the highest sheriff cards wins the outlaw card.

Collecting a complete gang gives a cash reward. The player with the most money wins. There are also five special cards in the outlaw deck: Lucky Luke and Jolly Jumper let the player draw outlaw cards from the deck. Ran Tan Plan causes some captured outlaws to escape.

Name: Caravan
Description:
A pick up and deliver game where players trade goods and put up buildings.  The 'robber' works against them as they try and build the most buildings.

The gameboard consists of an imaginary map showing four continents that are each divided into multiple countries. Every country is seeded with a token that represents one of eight different types of trade-goods. Players may pick up these tokens as they move their own pawn from country to country around the gameboard, and then collect payment for delivering the goods to a country where there is demand. Players spend their earnings to achieve a progression of game-ending conditions.

Name: Yotta Know Birds
Description:
Part of a series of "Yotta Know..." games on different topics, Yotta Know Birds is a game played on a six-by-six grid board on which players place cards depicting birds to be identified.  The first player to identify seven birds wins the round.  Rolling dice adds a randomizing element to gameplay, while a handicap system allows players of varying knowledge levels to play against each other.
 The game uses a deck of 60 birds, all of which are found in North America.
  Expanded by: 

    Yotta Know Mammals
    Yotta Know Waterfowl

Name: Sling Dingers
Description: This is a game of Indoor Lawn Darts. Using plastic pieces and plastic targets players try to softly lob the pieces into circular targets. Succeed and score a point. The game advertises that it could be played outdoors but the pieces are just not sturdy enough for the pounding that an outdoor game would inflict on them and the pieces are so light that outdoor winds would play havoc with the game. Certainly best played indoors.

Name: Think-Thunk
Description: Think Thunk is a strategy action game. Each player has a group of men who attempt to cross the board while trying to avoid shots taken by an opponent with a ball fired by spring action levers. There are blocking pins scattered on the playing field where you would try and place your pieces in order to protect them from the firing line.

Name: Fishy Business!
Description:
From the box: 
"A fabulously funny game of tropical fish trading!
Mr Plankton runs a crazy shop called Fishy Business. You've got to help him sell his weird and wonderful tropical fish, in particular the Outer Mongolian Mackerel, the Fantastic Finnish Flounder, the Brazilian Balloon Bloater and the Poisonous Tiger Trout.
Don't forget your fishing net!"

The winner is the player to get rid of all their cards first. Game play shares similarities with Uno, in that players play one card at a time from their hands, which must match either the same species as the previous card, or the same number. In addition, there are a selection of special cards which cause an opponent to pick up more fish from the pool, or which can be used to change species.

Name: Philanthropist: The National Gallery, London
Description:
Philanthropist: The National Gallery, London is the second art history trivia game from Mecenes Inc., following the more general Philanthropist.  As the title suggests, Philanthropist: The National Gallery, London focuses on the holdings of one of Britain's foremost art museums.

At the heart of the game are the 100 color reproductions of paintings from the museum.  Players compete to give away all of their money by answering questions about these paintings.  Questions are multiple choice, or players may opt to play an "Expert" card and answer without the multiple choice options for a greater reward.  Correct answers allow players to draw a "Philanthropist" card, which indicates the amount of a donation and has other effects.

Philanthropist: The National Gallery, London offers several variations on the game mechanics of the original, allowing players more strategic options and lifting this game above many standard trivia games.

Name: Magiczny Miecz: Labirynt Magów
Description:
Sfera released a number of expansions for Magiczny Miecz, three of which were very similar to expansions for Talisman.

Labyrint Magow (Mage's Labyrinth) was similar to the Talisman Dungeon.

It added a board and new cards to encounter. It also added Alternative Endings to the game, much like Talisman's Adventure expansion.

Name: Magia i Miecz: Jaskinia
Description:
This expansion is the only professionally produced expansion NOT to be produced by Games Workshop (or licensees of Talisman.

Jaskinia or the Cave, adds a new board to the game along with a new deck of cards to encounter.

It is thought to be a very difficult expansion as many of the enemies within the Cave have very high scores for Might or Magic.

It seems that the production of this expansion brought about an end to relations between Sfera and Games Workshop, as the license was revoked shortly after this.

Sfera went on to produce a Talisman-esque game, Magiczny Miecz.

Name: Magiczny Miecz: Jaskinia
Description:
This expansion was actually produced BEFORE the game of Magiczny Miecz was made as it was originally an expansion made for the Polish version of Talisman, Magia I Miecz.

Jaskinia or the Cave, adds a new board to the game along with a new deck of cards to encounter.

It is thought to be a very difficult expansion as many of the enemies within the Cave have very high scores for Might or Magic.

It is playable without Magiczny Miecz, with special rules. The goal is to get the Magic Crystal.

Name: Magiczny Miecz: Magia
Description:
Sfera's last expansion for Magiczny Miecz.

This added a number a cards to various decks, much like the Dragons expansion did for Talisman.

Name: Magiczny Miecz: Krypta Upiorów
Description:
An expansion based again on underground movement for Magiczny Miecz.

Krypta Upiorow (Crypt of Wraiths) brings a new board and cards to encounter, new professions (few "Knights of Gods").

This is very diffucult expansion, specially because of different type of exploring the board.

It is playable without Magiczny Miecz, with special rules.

Name: Magiczny Miecz: Gród
Description:
Another expansion for Magiczny Miecz based loosely on a Talisman theme.

Grod (Town) is very much like Talisman City.

It brings a new board and cards to encounter and few professions (Steward, Chieftain of Thieves, Duke's Envoy, Master Wizard).

Name: Pelotera
Description:
Pelotera is a very unique game.

Have two main components:

     50x70 cm board
     2 dice.


Each player represents a soccer team and participates in a soccer game with other player. Each time you roll the dice you will be able to get closer to make a goal, but in the way anything can happen.

For Ages 7 and up

Name: Blockade Runner
Description:
Blockade Runner was inspired by an actual Yankee civil war game.  The chance of the Runner getting into port is about the same as in 1864.

After the USA began the blockage, merchant ships became runners.  The Rewards were worth the risk.  Blockade Runners were leaving England hoping for a big payday.

Two, three or four people play this fast acting game.

For Ages 10 and up.

Name: MinenRäumer
Description:
Minenräumer or Mine Sweeper has been a classic computer game for years now. The game is addictive for anyone that starts to play. Mine Sweeper now is available as a boardgame, where two players challenge each other to defuse one another's mines. 
Both players deploy their mines in secret. After deployment the players call out locations to get information about the number of mines that surround it, or to defuse a mine in that field.

Name: Geheime Mission
Description: Players are spies trying to steal secret plans by playing cards into either the town or one of the embassies. Cards have 3 different values depending on the location /function they're played.

Name: Bienchen summ herum
Description: There is a colorful meadow with flowers. Bees fly from flower to flower to collect pollen. Dice is rolled to move the bees. Small children learn to distinguish the different colors.

Name: Warhammer (Fifth Edition): Tears of Isha
Description:
A campaign pack for 5th edition Warhammer: The Mass Combat Fantasy Roleplaying Game (1st Edition), Tears of Isha introduces a linked series of scenarios featuring the High Elf and Dark Elf armies.

Extra rules and special characters are introduced in the campaign pack. Box contents consist of the campaign rulebook; 4 battle scrolls for each player; a roster pad and card buildings used in the scenarios.

Name: Warhammer (Fifth Edition): The Grudge of Drong
Description:
A campaign pack for 5th edition Warhammer: The Mass Combat Fantasy Roleplaying Game (1st Edition), Grudge of Drong introduces a linked series of scenarios featuring the High Elf and Dwarf armies. The scenarios are set during the lead up to the Great War between the elves and dwarves.

Extra rules and special characters are introduced in the campaign pack. Box contents consist of the campaign rulebook; 4 battle scrolls for each player; a roster pad and card buildings used in the scenarios.

Name: Warhammer (Fifth Edition): Idol of Gork
Description:
A campaign pack for 5th edition Warhammer: The Mass Combat Fantasy Roleplaying Game (1st Edition), Idol of Gork introduces a linked series of scenarios featuring the Orc & Goblin and Empire armies.

Extra rules and special characters are introduced in the campaign pack. Box contents consist of the campaign rulebook; 4 battle scrolls for each player; a roster pad and card buildings used in the scenarios.

Name: Galactic Attack
Description:
Bagged game.  From the bag cover:
"You are the Commander of the United States Space Forces Galactic Fleet.  Recent intelligence reports state that the enemy have deployed an armada in a nearby solar system.  Your mission is to push back the advancing fleets and repel the enemy forces."

A low-complexity game of ship-to-ship combat and planet occupation between identical forces approaching each other from opposite ends of a map representing a star system.  The map has a square grid superimposed, and movement is orthogonal.  On a turn, a player rolls two dice and may make as many moves with any number of ships as he wishes, up to the total value of the two dice, but not to exceed the value of one of the dice in the movement of any, single ship.  Unit types are troopers, fighters, transports, and mines.  Fighters automatically eliminate troop ships; fighter vs. fighter is determined by high roller.  Troops are carried by troopships, and may be dropped on planets; combat on planets is resolved as with fighters.

Two sheets combine to form a 22"x16" mapboard.  121 thin counters are perforated for separation.  Two dice are also included.  A limited set of advanced rules are also provided.

Name: Game of State Capitals
Description:
Discs, each of which names one of the forty-eight state capitals, are dealt to the players. In turn, a spinner which indicates two of the states by number (the order in which they were added to the union, really) is spun. If the player has the state capital discs matching those states, the player must declare that fact to surrender the discs. Sometimes the spinner allows a player to surrender two discs.

Alaska and Hawaii were added to the game when those states entered the union.

The first player to place all one's state capitals in their proper places on the gameboard wins.

Name: The Spirit of '76
Description:
Brigade/Regiment-level simulation of the American Revolutionary War, specifically the Southern Campaign conducted between 1778 and 1782.  The four-sheet, 22"x16" strategic map is centered on the Carolinas, with portions of Virginia and Georgia also represented.  Approximately 250, half-inch counters represent the forces available.

Movement of forces is by pre-plotted orders, with opposing forces ending the week in the same hex having their combat resolved on a separate set of geomorphic, tactical combat boards.

The tactical combat system is rather advanced for the time, including such elements as LOS, panic, bayonet attacks, enfilade fire, cavalry charges, facing, and elevation advantages.  The strategic game also has rules for supply/foraging, lines of communication, weather, forced march, baggage trains, partisans, forts and garrisons.

Name: Off the Hook
Description:
Off The Hook is a fun-filled, action-packed poker game that combines calculated chance with thought-provoking strategy.

Each player gets ten white chips, two colored dice, one green marker, and one blue marker.  The starting player takes five "community" dice, and one green die in the closed Off the Hook box.  The player then shakes the box, and opens it to look inside, and announce a poker hand based on what they see.  The box is then passed to the next player, who can either call their bluff, accept the call by looking in the box an making a new (higher) call, or give up an "Off the Hook" marker to pass the box without penalty.

If a player gets caught bluffing, they lose the number of chips to the challenger equal to the number showing on the green die in the box.  Otherwise, the challenger pays.

The person with the most chips wins (usually the last one left in the game).

Home Page: http://www.offthehookpoker.com/

Name: Go Finish
Description:
This Western Australian production could possibly be described as parallel games of Scrabble without a board.  Players each have a collection of lettered tiles and they create their own set of words that interconnect in the style of a crossword.  Like Scrabble, each letter has a score with letters that are harder to use having a higher score.

Manufactured in Western Australia by Herbert Stone Pty Ltd, Trademark Registed Pending Taree Pty Ltd.  Judging by the seven-digit phone numbers it is pre-1997.

Name: SilverHawks
Description: SilverHawks is a simple war type game that has players attempting to stop the Evil Mon'Star. The game makes use of spinners in order to determine if targets have been hit. Game comes with 6 cardboard characters and 2 spinners.

Name: Dennis the Menace and Gnasher
Description:
This is a REAL Dennis the Menace game. It has all the naughty, silly fun of Dennis in 'The Beano' and it is easy to learn as well. Each player must play three dirty tricks on characters on the board using various items they collect on their travels. (What could you do with a banana, a bucket, a rope and six pints of rasher slop ? ! )

BUT ... look out for Sergeant Slipper, if he catches you in the act it's curtains !

This is THE Dennis game. Just for kids or the whole family, it is brilliant fun. When Dad & Mum turn into children you know you have a good game on the table !

Name: Skance
Description:
(Publisher's description)
There are two challenging games to play on the SKANCE board. Both are easy to learn and fast to play.
In game one "Vanquish", the winner is the player who successfully removes all other players pieces from the board. However, a sharp eye is needed as there are four different ways to remove a player from the game. Luck is of course important... but so is your skill and strategy.
Game two is "Thwart"  and the winner is the player who manages to occupy an opponent's home base with just one of his pieces. Sounds easy doesn't it? Wait until you try !

Name: Ma non i coperchi
Description:
A Italian party games introduced from a famous showman of TV.
Better if played with many people.

Name: Gioca con me al Campionato di Formula 1
Description: An old Italian racing game of F1. Move is spinner based. There is a plastic sheet where summarize, with counters, for every cars, laps, tire type, box stop etc.

Name: Kampen om Borås (Kunskapsspelet)
Description:
Kampen om BorÃ¥s (Kunskapsspelet) is a game about the Swedish city of Borås. The mechanics is, roughly, a mix of Monopoly and Trivial Pursuit where most of the questions are about the city and its history.

Home Page: http://www.kunskapsspelet.se

Name: Football Game
Description: Play on any flat surface, set out the flags & goals to represent a football pitch. Set out the players (counters) in any formation you wish & move the ball around by flicking. Place the white disc ( the ball) in the center & toss a coin to decide who kicks off.

Name: Hard Burn
Description:
A "Firefly"-themed card game similar to Mille Bornes.  Make money, but keep flyin'.
From the rulebook:
"Well, you’ve just pulled of a heist of valuable medications from St. Lucy’s Hospital in Ariel City on the planet Ariel. All you need to do is fly out to the border planets and sell them. However, the Hands of Blue are in pursuit! In order to escape them, you must fly through the Black and avoid all the hazards that will slow you down and get you pinched by them. If you fly far enough in the ‘Verse, you should be safe to sell off your stolen cargo. They won’t fly 86 million miles for a box of band-aids, will they? 
In this game you try to fly 86 million miles through space to escape the Hands of Blue. But you must be wary, because your competition is doing the same and will tip off your enemies to your location (by playing cards to stop or slow you down), of course, you can do the same! 
In the basic game, designed for 4 players, the object is to be the first crew to accumulate $5000 in platinum (that is the point system) over several rounds of play. In doing so, you must try to complete a trip of exactly 86 million miles in each round of play."

Name: Rise Again: Honest Brawls Between Folk
Description:
Rise Again: Honest Brawls Between Folk

Firefly-themed card based fighting game somewhat based on Kung Fu Fighting.
From the designer:
"You can’t take the sky from me: In RISE AGAIN, 2 to 6 players fight each other Firefly ‘Verse style, trying to beat the gos se (which we politely call “GUTS”) out of one another with various forms of brawlin’. Players can attack each other with Attack cards or by using a Weapon card they have in play. Players can make their attacks even more hi-larious by playing Attack Enhancement cards and by having a Stereotype card in play. Defenders use Block cards to avoid or cancel attacks, and can even play Guts Restoration cards to restore lost Guts."

Name: Black Hole Invaders
Description:
The object of the game is to get your space plane back to the Mothership first, or have 3 Mothership cards, but beware to the black Hole Invaders. If you end up with 3 Invader cards you are captured and out of the game.

A limited print run sci-fi game by Omega games.

Name: Firefly Card Game
Description: Play events and actions on each other while trying to do the job, get paid.  First one to amass 1000 credits, wins.

Name: Fische fangen
Description: A pond is filled with different types of fish. Dice rolls determine which type of fish is caught. Winner is the one who catches the most fish.

Name: Gunfight at Tombstone (Legends of the Far West)
Description:
"Gunfight at Tombstone" uses 8 high quality, huge miniatures (54 mm) to recreate the famous wild west shooting, so its high cost.

Each player controls one side (lawmen or outlaw in an 8 player game) with four cowboys each.
Each gunmen has his own and unique stats (drawing, movement, health, and hidden dice=shooting skill) and special abilities (re-rolls, cancel other abilities, improved shooting ranges...). The game uses some of the liars dice poker mechanics, you have to make the best hand possible to win your opponent and to pass a minimum hand depending on distance and covers, otherwise the shoot is lost. Unlike poker you don´t bet money but the bullets of your revolver or rifle. Depending on the bullets bet you make more or less damage. Movement and covers, ranges, team play, wise special ability using, and bullet administration-reload are crucial tactics to win the game.

A fast game and very easy to learn if you can play poker. A very original and unusual playable diorama.

Name: Dirty Dicing
Description:
In Dirty Dicing, players roll six standard dice and use the results to fill in boxes on a scoresheet.  Players also get two "smart moves" which they can use to pass a bad roll to the next player or to refuse dice which have been passed to them.  Doubles are ignored, so a roll with three doubles scores nothing and is known as "dirty dice".

Dirty Dicing was published in Counter Magazine #36.

Name: Cranium Squawkbox: Pirate's Passage
Description: Square cards are used to create a layout of paths through a square "ocean" with the box (which is also the goal square of the game) at the center.  The players' home islands/ starting squares are at the corners.  The game's box is a molded plastic affair containing a voice chip; in turn, players push a button on top to hear a pirate voice give commands such as Rotate a card, Flip a card, Sail the Seas (move one space if you can), etc.  First player to reach the treasure with his or her ship pawn is the winner.

Name: In the Name of Glory
Description:
In The Name Of Glory (ITNOG) is a grand tactical rules set designed for players seeking a game of moderate complexity. The basic unit is a brigade, comprised of four stands. It uses a card activation system, with a few twists (see below). But players always has fewer cards than units (ain’t that always the way?). The game focuses more on morale than raw strength, and in fact units and combat effects are measured in morale points, rather than strength points. While units pretty much obey the player’s wishes, the card system makes for a very dynamic and unpredictable turn sequence.

List Of Ingredients

ITNOG comes as a 94 page book with a spiral binding and two player aid cards on card stock (despite what the back cover says, these are not laminated). There is a dash of color on the inside, with small pictures of beautifully painted 28 mm figures through out. The rules run 56 pages, followed by seven of optional rules. Also included are:

Counters to be copied onto card stock and cut out. 
A chronology of the Revolutionary and Napoleonic Wars 
A list of the battles between 1792 and 1815 
Army Lists with commander ratings 
A small scenario the Battle of Arroyo de Molinos. 
Players will need to make a variety of counters or markers to play the game, or else develop paper rosters if they prefer.

Name: Take Your Pick: Movies, Music, & More
Description:
Like the original Take Your Pick, this is a party game where one player is the subject and everyone else draws three cards, each of which has two choices on it A or B.  The judges orient their cards in their hands such that they select one option from each card (turn the card one way, and the top word is circled, rotate it 180 degrees and the other word is circled).

In turn, each judge calls out the two words on one of his cards to the subject, who answers his preference.  If the judge was correct, he keeps the card and continues.  Wrong, and his turn ends.  The subject gets the same score as the judge who got the most points this turn.

Quick and entertaining, which is what SimplyFun party games seem to be.

This edition includes entertainment choices (Batman or Spiderman, P Diddy or Led Zeppelin, etc).

Name: Hip Flip
Description: This very unusual game had a stick with hands on both ends. Two dancers would stand on either side so that each person was being held by a hand. In between the hands was a spinable hanging plastic piece. The object of the game was to have the dancers gyrate in such a way that that center piece spun around. Whichever team that could keep the spinner rotating the longest was declared the winner.

Name: Head to Head Sudoku Game
Description:
From the Manufacturer: Battle against a friend with Cardinal's Head To Head Sudoku Game. Choose from three levels of difficulty and compete against the clock to see who comes out on top.
Game includes:
-100 puzzles & solutions
-2 game boards
-162 number tiles
-Timer
-Head to head divider

Name: Hokie Football
Description:
The object of Hokie Football is to score more points than your opponents while getting rid of all cards in your hand.  Cards represent the yard lines on an American football field, and players can score points by playing touchdowns and getting rid of cards.  Each hand ends when one player is out of cards.

Players start at mid field and move towards the end zones by playing one card per turn.  If a player cannot play a card from their hand, they put points in a pot, and the person who goes out of cards at the end of the round gets all of the points in the pot.  Playing touchdown cards scores for the player.

The player with the most points after multiple hands wins.

Name: Pitch Bowl
Description:
Pitch Bowl is a small print (400) game, self-published by a French designer. Rules are in English and French.

The game use the mechanics of the finger pitch to simulate a American Football game.
Each player directs wood tokens that represent Runner or Quarterback and different rules simulate Interceptions, Passes, etc.

The goal is to score 3 touchdowns.

Name: ATS Warfighting Guide #1
Description:
From the publisher's site:

The first in a series of detailed handbooks for ATS players filled with illustrated examples of play and instruction articles. Each issue is about 40 pages.

The first issue of ATS WARFIGHTING GUIDE #1 also includes a bonus multi-turreted tank play aid for owners of ADVANCED TOBRUK + a free bonus GOODY..

Articles cover analysis of machine-gun and mortars in ATS, a look at Panther Tanks in the system, compared to US Army data, and a couple of new variants...plus we hear more from the Hal Hock correspondence collection...and more!

Name: Enchanted Checkers
Description: Checkers variant. Meant to be played with miniatures. Each pawn has it's own special power. 36+ different powers available. Fantasy theme army lists included. Lots of Variants. Not your Grandpa's Checkers. Free homebrew ruleset available at: http://www.angelfire.com/games2/warpspawn/EC.html

Name: Rekkakuskit
Description:
In Rekkakuskit (the truck drivers) each player tries to make their living by running a transportation company. They get paid for delivering consignments but must cover their expenses. The winner is the player that has gained most capital at the end of the game.

In the beginning the players get the starting capital, the operation permit cards and place their pawns in Helsinki also taking the initial freight card. Each freight card shows a destination and a table of fees. The actual fee depends on the zone one's pawn is located and the type of the operation permit.

The game board is a map of Finland divided in three zones: southern, middle and northern Finland. The map shows the largest cities and a set of roads (tracks of squares) between them. There are two types of operation permits and you may buy an extended permit to operate with improved rates.

Moving your truck (pawn) happens by roll-and-move and should one land on a given square an event card is drawn. The major part of events consist of maintenance costs. Once the destination city is reached a new freight card is drawn.

Name: Roll-Ralli
Description: Each player is trying to acquire a ticket and go to the airport as fast as possible. The first player at the airport with a ticket is the winner.
